Distribution

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Brief
dataObjects.description: "Red List Category & Criteria: Least Concern ver 3.1  Year Assessed: 2010 Assessor/s: Zhuang, X. Reviewer/s: Juffe Bignoli, D., Bounphanmy, S., Meng, M., Homsombath, K. & Nophasead, L. Justification: This is a widespread species which faces no major threats.It is listed as Least Concern. Conservation Actions: No conservation measures are in place."

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Description
dataObjects.title: General Description
dataObjects.description: Stems elongated, 10-20 cm tall, branched. Leaves cauline, lanceolate, 3-6 cm long, 1-3 mm wide, veins 3, apex acuminate. Spathes sessile, green, 1-3 cm long, 1-3 mm wide. Flowers bisexual. Sepals green with purple midvein, linear-lanceolate, 2-4 mm long, 0.5-1 mm wide. Petals 6-10 mm long, 0.5-1 mm wide. Stamens 3; filaments 1-3 mm, smooth; anthers 1.8-2.5 mm. Ovary conical; styles 3-4 mm. Fruit 1-2.5 cm. Seeds 30-60, narrowly elliptic, smooth.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Distribution
dataObjects.description: Blyxa japonica is occurring in Anhui, Fujian, Guangdong, Guangxi, Guizhou, Hainan, Hubei, Hunan, Jiangsu, Jiangxi, Liaoning, Sichuan, Taiwan, Yunnan, Zhejiang of China, Bangladesh, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Myanmar, Nepal, Thailand, Europe.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.title: Diagnostic Description
dataObjects.description: Blyxa japonica is close relative of Blyxa leiosperma, but differs from the latter in its spathe sessile (vs. shortly pedunculate), anthers 1.8-2.5 mm (vs. 3.5-5 mm), styles 3-4 mm (vs. 5-6 mm), seeds narrowly elliptic (vs. ovoid).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: General Habitat
dataObjects.description: "Habitat and Ecology: It grows in paddy fields, ponds, and ditches.  Systems: Freshwater List of Habitats: 5, 5.4, 5.8, 15, 15.8"

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Habitat
dataObjects.description: Growing in paddy fields, ponds, channels.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Cyclicity
dataObjects.title: Cyclicity
dataObjects.description: Flowering and fruiting from May to October.
